## Keyword class

Represents the data of a Keyword used to classify items.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare class Keyword extends RepositoryLocalObject
```

**Extends:** [RepositoryLocalObject](./models.repositorylocalobject.md)

| [isAbstract](./models.keyword.isabstract.md)             |           | boolean                                                            | <p>Whether the Keyword is abstract.</p><p>An abstract Keyword cannot be used to classify items with. It is merely there to act as a parent for other Keywords. This property cannot be changed in a local copy.</p>                                             |
| [isRoot](./models.keyword.isroot.md)                     |           | boolean                                                            | Whether the Keyword is a root Keyword (i.e. it has no parent Keywords).                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| [key](./models.keyword.key.md)                           |           | string \| undefined                                                | <p>Custom key for the Keyword.</p><p>This key can be used to identify a Keyword in custom code; it has no special meaning to the TCM system. Unlike the Keyword's "IdentifiableObject.Title", this property cannot be changed in a local copy.</p>              |
| [parentKeywords](./models.keyword.parentkeywords.md)     |           | ReadonlyArray&lt;[Link](./models.link.md)<!-- -->&gt; \| undefined | <p>Parent Keywords of this Keyword.</p><p>Parent Keywords are used to form a Taxonomy of Keywords. Typically, a parent Keyword is a broader term/concept. The Parent Keywords must be from one of the allowed parent Categories of this Keyword's Category.</p> |
